metadata.title: CVE-2019-10149 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in Exim versions 4.87 to 4.91 (inclusive). Impropervalidation of recipient address in deliver_message() function in/src/deliver.c may lead to remote command execution.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-10149` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

exim4 - 4.82-3ubuntu2.4
exim4-base - 4.82-3ubuntu2.4
exim4-config - 4.82-3ubuntu2.4
exim4-daemon-heavy - 4.82-3ubuntu2.4
exim4-daemon-light - 4.82-3ubuntu2.4
eximon4 - 4.82-3ubuntu2.4
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: exim4 package in trusty/esm, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.82-3ubuntu2.4').
